description: TO PASS S.J. RES. 3, A JOINT RESOLUTION PROHIBITING THE EXPORTATION OF ARMS, AMMUNITION, AND IMPLEMENTS OF WAR FROM THE UNITED STATES TO SPAIN.

TO AMEND S. 415, A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE CONTINUATION OF THE RECONSTRUCTION FINANCE CORPORATION, BY ENDING THE FUNC- TIONS OF THE RECONSTRUCTION FINANCE CORPORATION ON JUNE 30, 1938 RATHER THAN JUNE 30, 1939.
TO PASS S. 415, A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE CONTINUATION OF THE FUNCTIONS OF THE RECONSTRUCTION FINANCE CORPORATION AND OTHER PORPOSES.

TO AMEND S. 416, A BILL RELATING TO STABILIZATION OF WEIGHT OF DOLLAR BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING SECTION OF A BILL EXTEND- ING THE TIME WITHIN WHICH THE POWERS RELATING TO THE STABI- LIZATION FUND AND ALTERATION OF THE WEIGHT OF THE DOLLAR COULD BE EXERCISE:  "PROVIDED, THAT UPON THE TERMINATION OF THE FUND, THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY SHALL SUBMIT TO CONGRESS A COMPLETE AUDIT AND REPORT UPON ITS OPERATIONS FROM THE TIME OF ITS ESTABLISHMENT."
TO AMEND H.R. 3587, A DEFICIENCY APPROPRIATION BILL, BY INCREASING THE APPROPRIATION FOR CONTRACT AIR MAIL SERVICE FROM $734,000 TO $984,000.
TO AMEND H.R. 3587, BY REDUCING THE APPROPRIATION FOR RELIEF AND WORK RELIEF FROM $790,000,000 TO $775,000,000.

TO AMEND H.R. 3587, BY PROVIDING THAT WHEN A SENATE OR A HOUSE COMMITTEE USES EMPLOYEES OF A GOVERNMENT DEPARTMENT, THE DEPARTMENT MUST REPORT TO THE SECRETARY OF THE SENATE OR TO THE CLERK OF THE HOUSE ON THE 10TH DAY OF EACH MONTH AS TO THE NUMBER OF EPLOYEES USED DURING THE PREVIOUS MONTH, THE AMOUNT OF TIME THEY SPENT IN WORKING FOR THE COMMITTEE, AND THE AMOUNT OF THEIR SALARIES THAT SHOULD BE ALLOCATED AGAINST THE COMMITTEE.

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 96, A JOINT RESOLUTION EXTENDING PRESI- DENTIAL AUTHORITY UNDER THE TARIFF ACT OF 1930, AS FOLLOWS: "PROVIDED, THAT AFTER THE ENACTMENT OF THIS RESOLUTION, NO PROCLAMATION SHALL BE MADE REDUCING OR OTHERWISE CHANGING ANY STATUTORY DUTYON FOREIGN IMPORTS BELOW THE AMOUNT NECESSARY, AS FOUND BY THE UNITED STATES TARIFF COMMISSION, TO EQUALIZE THE AMERICAN COST OF PRODUCTION OF LIKE OR SIMILAR DOMESTIC COMMODITIES."

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 96, AS FOLLOWS:  "EVERY PROCLAMATION OF THE PRESIDENT UNDER THIS ACT SHALL BE SUBMITTED TO THE CONGRESS WHILE IN SESSION, AND SHALL NOT BECOME EFFECTIVE UNTIL THE EXPIRATION OF 30 CALENDAR DAYS AFTER SUCH SUB- MISSION UNLESS CONGRESS, Y A MAJORITY VOTE OF BOTH HOUSES, PROVIDES FOR AN EARLIER EFFECTIVE DATE OF SUCH PROCLAMATION: PROVIDED, THAT IF CONGRESS SHALL ADJOURN BEFORE THE EXPIRA- TION OF 30 CALENDAR DAYS FROM THE DATE OF SUCH SUBMISSION, SUCH PROCLAMATION SHALL NOT BE EFFECTIVE ...

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 96, AS FOLLOWS:  PROVIDED, "THAT IN THE NEGOTIATION OF ANY NEW AGREEMENT OR AGREEMENTS, OR IN THE RENEWAL OR EXTENSION OF ANY EXISTING AGREEMENT OR AGREE- MENTS, UNDER THE AUTHORITY OF THIS ACT THE TARIFFS OR IMPORT DUTIES UPON ALL AGRCULTURAL AND HORTICULTURAL PRODUCTS SHALL BE MAINTAINED AT A POINT WHICH WILL AT LEAST EQUALIZE THE DIFFERENCE IN THE COST OF PRODUCTION THEREOF IN THE COUNTRY OR COUNTRIES DEALT WITH AND THE UNITED STATES AS DETERMINED BY THE UNITED STATES TARIFF COMMISS...

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 96, AS FOLLOWS:  PROVIDED, "THAT NO AGREEMENT OR PROCLAMATION SHALL BE MADE WHICH DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY SHALL HAVE THE EFFECT OF RESTRICTING SHALL RESULT IN OR REQUIRE RESTRICTIONS UPON THE PRODUCTION OR MARKETING IN THE UNITED STATESOF ANY AGRICULTURAL COMMODITY WHICH IS PRODUCED IN THE UNITED STATES IN QUANTITIES IN- SUFFICIENT FOR THE CONSUMPTION REQUIREMENTS THEREOF."
TO RECONSIDER TO H.J. RES. 16.  THE AMENDMENT WAS AGREED TO IN RC 1011.

RECONSIDERATION OF AN AMENDMENT TO H.J. RES. 96.  THE AMENDMENT PROVIDED, "THAT IN THE NEGOTIATION OF ANY NEW AGREEMENT OR AGREEMENTS, OR IN THE RENEWAL OR EXTENSION OF ANY EXISTING AGREEMENT OR AGREEMENTS, UNDER THE AUTHORITY OF THIS ACT THE TARIFFS OR MPORT DUTIES UPON ALL AGRICULTU- RAL AND HORTICULTURAL PRODUCTS SHALL BE MAINTAINED AT A POINT WHICH WILL AT LEAST EQUALIZE THE DIFFERENCE IN THE COST OF PRODUCTION THEREOF IN THE COUNTRY OR COUNTRIES DEALT WITH AND THE UNITED STATES AS DETERMINED BY THE ...
TO PASS H.J. RES. 96.

TO PASS H.R. 2518, A BILL TO PROVIDE FOR RETIREMENT OF JUS- TICES OF THE SUPREME COURT, WHICH HAD BEEN REPORTED FROM THE COMMITTEE ON THE JUDICIARY WITHOUT AMENDMENT.  (THIS VERY MODERATE BILL REPRESENTS THE LEGISLATIVE OUTCOME OF ROOSEVELT'S "COURT-PACKNG PLAN.")

TO AMEND S.J. RES. 51, A RESOLUTION AMENDING A RESOLUTION APPROVED AUG. 31, 1935, PROHIBITING TRADE WITH AND EXPORT TO BELLIGERENT NATIONS IN ARMS, AMMUNITION, AND IMPLEMENTS OF WAR.  THE MAJOR EFFECT OF THE AMENDMENT WOULD BE TO ELIMI- NATE THE EXECUTIV DISCRETION PERMITTING A CHOICE OF COMMODITIES TO BE EMBARGOED.
TO AMEND S.J. RES. 51, BY GIVING THE PRESIDENT DISCRETION IN DETERMINING WHEN IT WAS NECESSARY TO LIMIT OR CONTROL THE COUNTRY'S EXPORTS.
TO PASS S.J. RES. 51.
TO PASS H.R. 5232, A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE NAVY DEPARTMENT, 1938.

TO AMEND H.R. 4985, A BILL TO REGULATE INTERSTATE COMMERCE IN BITUMINOUS COAL, BY ADDING LANGUAGE EXPRESSING THE SENSE OF CONGRESS THAT SIT-DOWN STRIKES ARE ILLEGAL AND CON- TRARY TO SOUND PUBLIC POLICY.
TO AMEND H.R. 4985, BY STRIKING OUT THE BILL'S PROVISION ASSURING IMMUNITY FROM ANTI-TRUST PROSECUTION TO CODE MEMBER OR DISTRICT BOARD MEMBERS.
TO PASS H.R. 4985.

TO PASS S. CON. RES. 7, A RESOLUTION EXPRESSING CONGRESSIO- NAL DISAPPROVAL OF SIT-DOWN STRIKES AND THE "INDUSTRIAL SPY SYSTEM," AND ALSO OF EMPLOYERS WHO DENY COLLECTIVE BARGAIN- ING, FOSTER COMPANY UNIONS, OR ENGAGE IN OTHER UNFAIR LABOR PRACTICES.
TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON S.J. RES. 51.
TO PASS H.R. 4408, A BILL TO PROVIDE FOR THE RENEWAL OF STAR-ROUTE CONTRACTS AT 4-YEAR INTERVALS.

TO AMEND H.R. 6730, A BILL MAKING DEFICIENCY APPROPRIATIONS, BY APPROPRIATING MONEY FOR A DAM AT OR NEAR GILBERTSVILLE, KY., RATHER THAN FOR PRELIMINARY INVESTIGA- TIONS FOR A SITE ON THE LOWER TENNESSEE RIVER.
TO AMEND H.R. 6551, A BILL TO ESTABLISH A CIVILIAN CONSERVATION CORPS, BY REDUCING THE SALARY AUTHORIZATION FOR A DIRECTOR FROM $12,000 TO $10,000 PER ANNUM.
TO AMEND H.R. 6551, BY LIMITING THE OPERATIONS OF THE MEASURE TO 2 YEARS FROM JULY 1, 1937.
TO PASS H.R. 6551.
TO OVERRIDE PRESIDENTIAL VETO OF H.R. 5478, A BILL TO ALLOW EXTENSION OF GOVERNMENT SPONSORED TERM INSURANCE.
TO AMEND H.J. RES. 361, A BILL MAKING RELIEF APPROPRIATIONS, BY RESTRICTING THE USE OF ALLOCATED BUT UNSPENT FUNDS IN THE INIATION OF NEW PROJECTS.

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 361, BY REDUCING FROM 40 TO 25 PERCENT THE AMOUNT OF LOCAL FUNDS THAT MUST BE RAISED TO INITIATE WORK-RELIEF PROJECTS.  IT ALSO ALLOWS THE PRESIDENT THE DISCRETION OF FURTHER LOWERING THE PERCENTAGE IN CASES WHERE THE COMMUNITY COULD NT MEET THE MINIMUM CONTRIBUTION.

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 361, BY PROHIBITING THE WPA FROM INITIAT- ING ANY NEW PROJECTS UNLESS THAT AGENCY COULD CERTIFY THAT THE FINANCING TO COMPLETE THE PROJECT WAS AVAILABLE.  THE AMENDMENT ALSO REQUIRES THAT 40 PERCENT OF THE FUNDS NEEDED FOR NEW PROJECTSMUST BE SUPPLIED BY NON-FEDERAL FUNDS-- EXCEPT IN EXCEPTIONAL CIRCUMSTANCES.

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 361, BY GIVING TO THE STATES THE RESPON- SIBILITY FOR RELIEF ADMINISTRATION AND DECISIONS.  IT WOULD HAVE CREATED A FEDERAL FUND FOR RELIEF PURPOSES BUT WOULD HAVE REQUIRED AT LEAST A 25 PERCENT CONTRIBUTION BY THE STATES.  THE FUNDS WRE TO BE ALLOCATED ON THE BASIS OF POPULATION, FINANCIAL RESOURCES, UNEMPLOYMENT, AND LIVING COSTS.

TO AMEND H.R. 6692, A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS, FOR THE MILITARY ESTABLISHMENT BY PROVIDING THAT NONE OF THE FUNDS APPROPRIATED IN THIS ACT SHALL BE USED FOR SUPPORT OF ANY COMPULSORY MILITARY TRAINING IN ANY CIVIL SCHOOL OR COLLEGE, OR FOR THE PAY OF NY OFFICER, ENLISTED MAN, OR EMPLOYEE OF ANY CIVIL SCHOOL OR COLLEGE WHICH PENALIZES STUDENTS WHO, BECAUSE OF CONSCIENTIOUS CONVICTIONS OR BECAUSE OF RELIGIOUS BELIEFS, OBJECT TO ENROLLMENT IN A COURSE IN MILITARY TRAINING.
TO AMEND H.J. RES. 375, A BILL TO PROVIDE REVENUE, BY REDUCING THE EXTENSION OF TAXES ON VARIOUS COMMODITIES FROM 2 YEARS TO 1 YEAR.
TO AMEND H.J. RES. 375, BY PROVIDING FOR AN INCREASED TAX RATE BASED ON THE PROGRESSIVE TAXATION PRINCIPLE.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH SENATOR LA FOLLETTE'S AMENDMENT TO H.J. RES. 375 TO PROVIDE FOR AN INCREASED TAX RATE WAS PASSED.
TO RECONSIDER SENATOR LA FOLLETTE'S AMENDMENT TO H.J. RES. 375 TO PROVIDE FOR AN INCREASED TAX RATE ON THE PROGRESSIVE TAXATION PRINCIPLE.

TO AMEND H.R. 6958, A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR DEPART- MENT OF INTERIOR, BY REDUCING THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE DEVELOPMENT AND FURTHER EXPANSION OF VOCATIONAL EDUCATION FROM $14,483,000 TO $4,290,000.
TO OVERRULE VETO OF H.R. 6763, A BILL TO EXTEND FOR 1 YEAR THE INTEREST RATES ON CERTAIN FEDERAL LAND-BANK NOTES.
TO RECOMMIT TO THE COMMITTEE ON THE JUDICIAL BRANCH OF GOVERNMENT.  S. 1392, A BILL TO REORGANIZE THE JUDICIARY BRANCH.

TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO S. 69, THE INTERSTATE COMMERCE ACT. THE AMEND. OFFERED BY SENATOR COPELAND WHICH WOULD HAVE ADDED HOUSE BILL 1507, THE ANTILYNCHING BILL, TO S. 69, A BILL LIMITING THE SIZE OF TRAINS IN INTERSTATE COMMERCE.
TO RECOMMIT S. 69, THE INTERSTATE COMMERCE ACT TO THE COMMITTEE ON INTERSTATE COMMERCE.

TO AMEND S. 2475, A BILL TO ESTABLISH FAIR LABOR STANDARDS IN EMPLOYMENT, BY PROVIDING THAT THE AVERAGE IMPORTS OF ALL CLASSES OF GOODS FOR THE PRECEEDING 5 YEARS SHOULD BE DETERMINED, AND THEN NO IMPORTS ABOVE THAT AMOUNT SHOULD BE ALLOWED INTO THE UNITD STATES UNLESS SUCH IMPORTS WERE MANUFACTURED UNDER CONDITIONS EQUIVALENT TO THOSE SET UP BY S

TO AMEND S. 2475, BY ADDING--"THE PROVISIONS OF THIS ACT SHALL NOT APPLY TO TOBACCO WAREHOUSES, COTTON COMPRESSES, COTTON WAREHOUSES, COTTON GINNING AND BAILING, THEIR EMPLOYERS OR EMPLOYEES, WHERE THE EMPLOYMENT IS SEASONAL IN CHARACTER."  THE PRESIDINGOFFICER BROKE THE TIE BY VOTING NAY.
TO AMEND S. 2475, BY EXEMPTING COMPANIES EMPLOYING 10 OR FEWER PERSONS FROM THE PROVISION OF THIS ACT.

TO AMEND S. 2475, BY PROVIDING THAT MANUFACTURED OR PRO- CESSED GOODS COMING INTO THE UNITED STATES, IN COMPETITION WITH AMERICAN GOODS FROM COUNTRIES WHERE THE STANDARDS OF LABOR AND LIVING AND WAGE HOURS ARE BELOW U.S. STANDARDS, SHOULD NOT BE PERMITTE TO ENTER.

TO AMEND S. 2475, BY ADDING--"THAT THE PROVISIONS OF PARA- GRAPH "C" SHALL NOT APPLY TO EMPLOYEES EMPLOYED IN A PLANT LOCATED IN DAIRY-PRODUCTION AREAS IN WHICH MILK, CREAM, OR BUTTERFAT ARE RECEIVED, PROCESSED, SHIPPED, OR MANUFACTURED."
TO AMEND S. 2475, BY EXEMPTING EMPLOYEES ENGAGED IN PRO- CESSING OR PACKING PERISHABLE AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTS DURING THE HARVESTING SEASON.  FROM CERTAIN PROVISIONS OF THE BILL.
TO RECONSIDER AN AMENDMENT TO S. 2475, WHICH WOULD HAVE PREVENTED PRISON-MADE GOODS FROM BEING BROUGHT INTO COM- PETITION WITH GOODS MADE BY FREE LABOR.  (VICE PRESIDENT VOTES NAY)

TO AMEND S. 2475, BY ADDING--"THE TERM 'PERSON EMPLOYED IN AGRICULTURE', AS USED IN THIS ACT, INSOFAR AS IT SHALL REFER TO FRESH FRUITS OR VEGETABLES, SHALL INCLUDE PERSONS EMPLOYED WITHIN THE AREA OF PRODUCTION ENGAGED IN PREPARING, PACKING, OR STORING UCH FRESH FRUITS OR VEGETABLES IN THEIR RAW OR NATURAL STATE."
TO AMEND S. 2475, BY DELETING ALL THE PROVISIONS OF THE BILL REFERRING TO CHILD LABOR AND INSERT IN ITS PLACE S. 2226 AS AMENDED BY THE COMMITTEE ON INTERSTATE COMMERCE.
TO AMEND S. 2475, BY EXEMPTING FROM CERTAIN PROVISIONS OF THE ACT "PERSONS DIRECTLY EMPLOYED IN THE GINNING AND BAILING OF COTTON WHERE SUCH EMPLOYMENT IS SEASONAL."

TO AMEND S. 2475, BY AMENDING A COMMITTEE AMENDMENT.  ON PAGE 66 OF THE COMM. AMENDMENT IT IS PROPOSED TO STRIKE OUT LINES 18, 19, AND 20 AND IN LIEU THEREOF TO INSERT THE FOLLOWING:  "(2) SHALL BE PUBLISHED IN THE FEDERAL REGISTER AND SHALL NOT TAKE EFFCT UNTIL THE CONGRESS HAS BEEN IN SESSION AT LEAST 60 CALENDAR DAYS AFTER THE DATE OF SUCH PUBLICATION."
TO AMEND S. 2475, BY ADOPTING A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE ENTIRE BILL AS REPORTED BY THE COMMITTEE ON EDUCATION AND LABOR.
TO RECOMMIT S. 2475, TO THE COMMITTEE ON EDUCATION AND LABOR.
TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO S. 2475.  OFFERED BY SENATOR COPELAND WHICH WOULD HAVE ADDED THE ANTILYNCHING BILL AS PERFECTED BY THE SENATE COMMITTEE ON THE JUDICIARY TO THE PENDING LEGISLATION.
TO AMEND S. 2475, BY PROVIDING THAT APPOINTMENTS TO POSITIONS MADE UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF S. 2475, THE ANNUAL SALARY OF WHICH IS $4000 OR MORE SHALL BE SUBJECT TO CONFIRMATION BY THE SENATE.
TO PASS S. 2475.

TO AMEND S. 1685, A BILL TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FOR HOUSING BY PROVIDING THAT NO AGREEMENT OR INSTRUMENT MADE PURSUANT TO THIS ACT SHALL BE ENTERED INTO BY THE AUTHORITY WITH RESPECT TO ANY PROJECT COSTING MORE THAN $4,000 PER FAMILY UNIT OR MOR THAN $1,000 PER ROOM."

TO AMEND S. 1685, PROVIDING THAT "THIS ACT SHALL EXPIRE 3 YEARS AFTER THE APPROVAL THEREOF:  PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT ALL CONTRACTS ENTERED INTO AND ALL COMMITMENTS MADE BY THE BOARD SHALL BE CARRIED OUT BY SUCH AGENCY OR AUTHORITY AS THE CONGRESS MAY DESGNATE."
TO AMEND S. 1685, BY ELIMINATING THE CREATION OF AN INDE- PENDENT HOUSING AUTHORITY AND PLACED THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE ACT UNDER THE DEPARTMENT OF INTERIOR.

TO TABLE THE MOTION BY SENATOR MCCARRAN TO RECONSIDER AN AMENDMENT TO S. 1685 OFFERED BY SENATOR BYRD.  BYRD'S AMEND. WAS AS FOLLOWS:  "NO CONTRACT FOR LOANS, ANNUAL CONTRIBU- TIONS, CAPITAL GRANTS, SALE, LEASE, MORTGAGE, OR ANY OTHER AGREEMENT OR INSTRUENT MADE PURSUANT TO THIS ACT SHALL BE ENTERED INTO BY THE AUTHORITY WITH RESPECT TO ANY PROJECT COSTING MORE THAN $4,000 PER FAMILY UNIT OR MORE THAN $1,000 PER ROOM."
TO PASS S. 1685.

TO AMEND S. 1567, A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE CONSERVATION OF A MINERAL RESOURCE PERTAINING TO THE NATIONAL DEFENSE (HELIUM), BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING PROVISION TO AN AMENDMENT OFFERED BY SENATOR LOGAN:  "THE NATIONAL MUNITIONS CONTROL BOARD SHALL REPORT, ONJAN
TO PASS S. 1567, A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE CONSERVATION OF A MINERAL RESOURCE PERTAINING TO NATIONAL DEFENSE (HELIUM).
TO ADJOURN, A MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF THE H.R. 1507, AN ANTILYNCH BILL.
TO RECESS, A MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1507, AN ANTI-LYNCH BILL.
TO RECOMMIT THE NOMINATION OF HUGO BLACK TO THE SUPREME COURT TO THE COMMITTEE ON THE JUDICIARY.
TO CONFIRM THE NOMINATION OF HUGO BLACK TO BE ASSOCIATE JUSTICE OF THE SUPREME COURT.
A MOTION THAT A SPEECH DELIVERED BY SENATOR BARKLEY IN FRANCE BE READ TO THE SENATE.

TO AMEND S. 2787, A BILL RELATING TO AGRICULTURAL COMMODITIES IN INTERSTATE TRADE, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING PROVISIONS TO THE BILL:  "NEW ADJUSTMENT CONTRACTS SHALL BE PREPARED COVERING FARMING OPERATIONS WITH RESPECT TO WHEAT AND CORN PLANTED FOR HARVESTIN THE YEARS 1939 AND 1940, AND SUCH CONTRACTS SHALL BE OF SUCH PERIODS, NOT TO EXCEED 2 YEARS, AS THE SECRETARY SHALL DETERMINE" "NO ADJUSTMENT CONTRACT SHALL BE ENTERED INTO COVERING FARMING OPERATIONS WITH RESPECT TO ANY COMMODITY PLANTED FOR HARVEST I...

TO AMEND S. 2787, BY PROVIDING THAT WHENEVER THE SUPPLY OF CORN AT THE BEGINNING OF THE SEASON EXCEEDED 15 PER CENT OF THE NORMAL SUPPLY, THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE WOULD CALL A CONFERENCE TO INVESTIGATE THE SITUATION.  THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT SET THEPERCENTAGE AT 10 PERCENT.

TO AMEND S. 2787, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING PROVISION TO THE BILL:  "IN MAKING ALLOTMENTS HEREUNDER WITH RESPECT TO BRIGHT TOBACCO, THE OFFICERS ADMINISTERING THIS ACT SHALL NOT REDUCE THE QUOTA OF A FARMER LIVING ON HIS FARM AND DERIVING HIS LIVELIHOOD THREFROM MORE THAN 10 PERCENT OF HIS 10 YEAR AVERAGE IF SUCH AVERAGE IS 15,000 POUNDS OR LESS, AND IF HIS 10 YEAR AVERAGE IS 10,000 POUNDS OR LESS HIS QUOTA SHALL NOT BE REDUCED MORE THAN 5 PERCENT, PROVIDED IN EITHER CASE SUCH FARMER SHALL COMPLY WITH THE ...
TO AMEND S. 2787, BY EXEMPTING THE LITTLE FARMER UP TO $300 FROM QUOTA REDUCTIONS AND ACREAGE REDUCTIONS AND BASING HIM ON A FIXED AMOUNT OF $300.

TO AMEND S. 2787, BY PROVIDING THAT "IN MAKING ALLOTMENTS HEREUNDER WITH RESPECT TO BRIGHT (FLUE-CURED) TOBACCO THE OFFICERS ADMINISTERING THIS ACT SHALL NOT REDUCE THE QUOTA OF A FARMER LIVING ON HIS FARM AND DERIVING HIS LIVELIHOOD THEREFROM MORE THAN 0 PERCENT OF HIS 5-YEAR AVERAGE IF SUCH AVERAGE IS LESS THAN 10,000 POUNDS AND MORE THAN 5,000 POUNDS, AND IF HIS 5-YEAR AVERAGE IS 5,000 POUNDS LESS HIS QUOTA SHALL NOT BE REDUCED MORE THAN 5 PERCENT, PROVIDED IN EITHER CASE SUCH FARMER SHALL COMPLY WITH...
TO AMEND S. 2787, BY EXEMPTING DAIRY CATTLE FROM THE FEED GRAINS PROVISION OF THE ACT.
TO AMEND S. 2787, BY SETTING A MAXIMUM OF $500,000,000 FOR THE ENACTMENT OF THIS BILL.

TO AMEND S. 2787, BY ELIMINATING THE SECTION OF THE BILL MAKING A SPECIFIC APPROPRIATION AND SUBSTITUTED:  "THERE IS HEREBY AUTHORIZED TO BE APPROPRIATED, FOR EACH FISCAL YEAR FOR THE ADMINISTRATION OF THIS ACT AND FOR THE MAKING OF SOIL CONSERVATION ACTPAYMENT AND PARITY PAYMENTS UNDER THIS ACT SUCH SUMS AS ARE NECESSARY."

TO AMEND S. 2787, BY ELIMINATING THE FOLLOWING PROVISION RELATED TO THE AMOUNT OF THE NATIONAL MARKETING QUOTA ALLOTTED TO EACH STATE WHICH WAS TO BE APPROPRIATED BY THE SECRETARY AMONG THE SEVERAL COUNTIES OR SUBDIVISIONS IN EACH STATE:  "THE PROPORTIONTHAT THE LAND DEVOTED TO TILLED LANDS ON COTTON FARMS IN THE COUNTY IS OF THE LAND DEVOTED TO TILLED LANDS ON ALL COTTON FARMS IN THE STATE."

TO AMEND S. 2787, BY ESTABLISHING A DOMESTIC ALLOTMENT PLAN FOR FARMERS FOR THEIR SHARE OF THE DOMESTIC MARKET.  IT PRO- VIDES THAT THE COMMODITY CREDIT CORPORATION SHALL LOAN THE FARMER EITHER PARITY OR 20 CENTS A POUND, WHICHEVER IS LOWER, AND PROVIDESTHAT MANUFACTURERS MAY PURCHASE COTTON NOT COVERED BY THE DOMESTIC ALLOTMENT PLAN FOR EXPORT TRADE AT THE REGULAR WORLD PRICE

TO AMEND S. 2787, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING PROVISION:  "PAY- MENTS WITH RESPECT TO ANY FARM (EXCEPT FOR LANDS WHICH THE SECRETARY DETERMINES SHOULD NOT BE UTILIZED FOR THE HARVEST- ING OF CROPS BUT SHOULD BE PERMANENTLY USED FOR GRAZING PURPOSES ONLY) SHAL BE FURTHER CONDITIONED UPON THE UTILIZATION OF THE LAND, WITH RESPECT TO WHICH SUCH PAYMENT IS MADE, SO THAT SOIL BUILDING AND SOIL-CONSERVING CROPS PLANTED OR PRODUCED ON LANDS NORMALLY USED FOR THE PRODUC- TION OF COTTON, WHEAT, RICE, TOBACCO, OR FIEL...

TO AMEND S. 2787.  SENATOR MCNARY'S AMENDMENT, AGREED TO IN RC 2012, WAS IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR AN AMENDMENT. THIS VOTE IS ON THAT ORIGINAL AMENDMENT, AS AMENDED BY SUB- STITUTING MCNARY'S AMENDMENT.  IN EFFECT, IT IS A REVOTE OF ROLL CALL 201.

TO AMEND S. 2787, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING PROVISION--=THE COMMODITY CREDIT CORPORATION IS HEREBY AUTHORIZED AND DIRECTED TO PROCEED IMMEDIATELY TO PURCHASE 30,000,000 BUS- HELS OF PACIFIC NORTHWEST WHITE WHEAT, TO BE DISPOSED OF ACCORDING TO RULES AND REULATIONS PROMULGATED BY THE SECRETARY OF AGRICULTURE."

TO AMEND S. 2787, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING PROVISION--"THE COMMODITY CREDIT CORPORATION IS HEREBY AUTHORIZED AND DIRECTED TO PROCEED IMMEDIATELY TO PURCHASE COTTON IN THE OPEN MARKET AND TO CONTINUE TO MAKE SUCH PURCHASES UNTIL THE AVERAGE PRICE OF THE SEEN-EIGHTS MIDDLING COTTON ON THE 10 DESIGNATED SPOT COTTON MARKETS IS 10 CENTS PER POUND, OR UNTIL CORPORATION HAS PURCHASED 6,000,000 BALES OF COTTON OF THE 1937 CROP
TO RECONSIDER AN AMENDMENT TO S. 2787.  THE AMENDMENT IS DESCRIBED IN ROLL CALLS NO. 2012, 2013.

TO SUBSTITUTE FOR S. 2787, A PLAN PROVIDING THAT THE TARIFF LAWS OF THE UNITED STATES, IF NECESSARY, SHOULD BE AMENDED SO AS TO PUT A TARIFF ON COTTON, CORN, WHEAT, RICE, AND TOBACCO HIGH ENOUGH TO PREVENT ANY IMPORTS FROM OTHER COUNTRIES WHICH WOULD TEN TO BREAK DOWN THE PRICE IN THE DOMESTIC MARKET.
TO RECOMMIT S. 2787 TO COMM. ON AGRICULTURE AND FORESTRY.
TO PASS S. 2787.
TO AMEND H.R. 8730 THE NATIONAL HOUSING ACT, BY REENACTING TITLE I OF THE NATIONAL HOUSING ACT OF 1936.

TO PASS H.R. 8730.
TO ADJOURN, A MOTION MADE DURING THE DEBATE ON H.R. 1507, THE ANTI-LYNCHING BILL.
THAT SERGEANT AT ARMS BE DIRECTED TO PROCURE THE ATTENDANCE OF ABSENT SENATORS UNTIL A QUORUM IS PRODUCED.
THAT THE ORDER DIRECTING THE SERGEANT AT ARMS TO PROCURE THE ATTENDANCE OF ABSENT SENATORS BE VACATED.
CONFIRMATION OF NOMINATION OF F. ROY YOKE TO BE COLLECTOR OF INTERNAL REVENUE, WEST VIRGINIA.

TO TABLE A MOTION BY SENATOR MCKELLAS THAT THE SERGEANT AT ARMS BE DISCHARGED FROM THE FURTHER EXECUTION OF THE ORDER TO PROCURE THE PRESENCE OF ABSENT SENATORS.  (A QUORUM WAS STILL NOT ENOUGH FOR THE VOTE ON THIS MOTION.)
TO TABLE A MOTION BY SENATOR MCKELLAR THAT THE SERGEANT AT ARMS BE DISCHARGED FROM THE EXECUTION OF THE ORDER TO PRO- CURE THE PRESENCE OF ABSENT SENATORS.
TO IMPOSE CLOTURE ON DEBATE H.R. 1507, AN ANTI-LYNCHING BILL.

TO CONSIDER H.R. 8837, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE INDEPENDENT OFFICES, IN LIEU OF HOUSE BILL 1507, AN ANTI-LYNCHING BILL.

TO TABLE AN APPEAL FROM THE DECISION OF THE CHAIR IN REGARDS TO WHETHER THE CONFEREES ON THE PENDING LEGISLATION, H.R. 8505, A BILL TO PROVIDE FOR NATIONAL SOIL CONSERVATION, EXCEEDED THEIR POWERS.  (APPEAL MADE BY DUFFY)

TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 8508, A BILL TO PRO- VIDE FOR THE CONSERVATION OF NATIONAL SOIL RESOURCES AND TO PROVIDE AN ADEQUATE AND BALANCED FLOW OF AGRICULTURAL COMMODITIES IN INTERSTATE AND FOREIGN COMMERCE.

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 596, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING PROVISION TO THE JOINT RESOLUTION:  "PROVIDED, THAT THE SECOND PARAGRAPH OF THE FIRST SECTION OF THE JOINT RESOLUTION ENTITLED 'JOINT RESOLUTION MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR RELIEF PURPOSES,' APPROVED JUNE 29,1937, SHALL NOT APPLY TO THIS JOINT RESOLUTION."
TO AMEND H.J. RES. 596 BY PROVIDING THAT THE COMMUNITY'S SHARE OF COST OF WORK RELIEF PROJECTS MAY BE PAID EITHER IN MATERIALS OR FUNDS.
TO PASS H.J. RES. 596.

TO DISCHARGE THE COMMITTEE ON BANKING AND CURRENCY FROM THE FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF S. 3428, PROVIDING FOR FINANCING CERTAIN SELF-LIQUIDATING PUBLIC WORKS, AND TO REFER THE BILL TO THE COMMITTEE ON POST OFFICES AND POST ROADS.
TO CONFIRM THE NOMINATION OF ROBERT H. HACKSON TO BE SOLICITOR GENERAL OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO AMEND S. 3331, A BILL TO PROVIDE FOR REORGANIZATION OF EXECUTIVE AGENCIES, BY EXCLUDING THE PROVISIONS IN THE RE- PORTED BILL WHICH SEEK TO EXPAND AND ENLARGE THE CLASSIFIED CIVIL SERVICE LAW AND LAWS RELATING TO THE FIXING AND DETERMINING OF THE SALAIES OF GOVERNMENT EMPLOYEES UNDER THE CLASSIFICATION LAW.
TO AMEND S. 3331, BY PROVIDING FOR CONGRESSIONAL APPROVAL OF EXECUTIVE REORGANIZATION PLANS.

TO AMEND S. 3331, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING PROVISION:  "TO REDUCE THE REGULAR EXPENDITURES OF THE GOVERNMENT FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1940, BY AN AMOUNT NOT LESS THAN 10 PERCENT OF THE REGULAR EXPENDITURES OF THE GOVERNMENT FOR THE FISCAL YEAR NDING JUNE 30, 1939."

TO AMEND S. 3331, BY FORBIDDING THE PRESIDENT TO ABOLISH OR TRANSFER THE FOREST SERVICE FROM THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE TO ANY OTHER EXECUTIVE DEPARTMENT OR ABOLISH OR TRANSFER TO ANY OTHER AGENCY OR DEPARTMENT ANY OF THE FUNCTIONS EXERCISED BY THE FOEST SERVICE."
TO AMEND S. 3331, BY EXEMPTING THE VETERANS' ADMINISTRATION FROM THE OPERATION OF THE BILL.  THE PRESIDING OFFICER VOTED "NAY," TO BREAK THE TIE.
TO AMEND S. 3331, BY PREVENTING THE CONSOLIDATION, ABOLI- TION, OR TRANSFER OF THE FUNCTIONS OF THE VETERANS' ADMINISTRATION.  THE PRESIDING OFFICER VOTED "NAY," TO BREAK THE TIE.
TO AMEND S. 3331, BY SETTING UP RULES OF PROCEDURE FOR PRESIDENTIAL ASSISTANTS.
TO TABLE A MOTION TO RECONSIDER AN AMEND. TO S. 3331 PRE- VENTING THE ABOLITION, CONSOLIDATION, OR TRANSFER OF THE FUNCTIONS OF THE VETERANS' ADMINISTRATION.
TO AMEND S. 3331, BY REQUIRING THE PRESIDENT TO MAKE A DETAILED STATEMENT SHOWING THE DECREASE IN EXPENDITURES RE- SULTING FROM EXECUTIVE ORDERS FACILITATING REORGANIZATION.
TO AMEND S. 3331, BY EXCLUDING THE BUREAU OF BIOLOGICAL SURVEY FROM THE PROVISIONS OF THE ACT.

TO AMEND S. 3331, BY ELIMINATING FROM THE BILL THE PROVI- SIONS WHICH ABOLISH THE COMPTROLLER GENERAL AND SUBSTITUTE AN AUDITOR GENERAL.  IT ALSO SPECIFICALLY AUTHORIZES A PREAUDIT, AND PROVIDES THE METHOD OF PROCEDURE IN THE EVENT OF PREAUDIT.
TO RECOMMIT S. 3331 TO THE SELECT COMMITTEE ON GOV'T ORGANIZATION.
TO PASS S. 3331.

TO AMEND H.R. 8993, A BILL MAKING NAVAL APPROPRIATIONS, 1939, BY PROVIDING FOR THE PRELIMINARY WORK ON A GRAVING DOCK AUTHORIZED BY THE CONGRESS FOR THE PUGET SOUND NAVY YARD AT BREMERTON, WASHINGTON.  THE AMENDMENT WOULD HAVE INCREASED THE APPROPRIATIONBY APPROXIMATELY $2,500,000.
TO RECONSIDER AN AMEND. TO H.R. 8993, PROVIDING FOR THE PRE- LIMINARY WORK ON A GRAVING DOCK AUTHORIZED BY THE CONGRESS FOR THE PUGET SOUND NAVY YARD AT BREMERTON, WASHINGTON.
TO PASS H.R. 8993.
TO AMEND H.R. 9995, A BILL MAKING MILITARY APPROPRIATIONS FOR 1939, BY, ON PAGE 45, LINE 12, STRIKING OUT "$32,232,034" AND INSERT "$48,038,259."
TO AMEND H.R. 9995, A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL 1939, BY, ON PAGE 45, LINE 19 AFTER THE WORDS "EXCESS OF", STRIKING OUT "$2,900,000" AND INSERTING "12,900,000."
TO AMEND H.R. 9682 THE REVENUE ACT, BY STRIKING FROM H.R. 9682 THE EXCISE TAXES PROVIDED ON PORK PRODUCTS.
TO AMEND H.R. 9682, BY REDUCING THE TAX ON SALES OF PRODUCE FOR FUTURE DELIVERY FROM 3 CENTS TO 1 CENT PER HUNDRED DOLLARS.
TO AMEND H.R. 9682, BY PROVIDING ADDITIONAL PENALTIES FOR THE TRANSPORTATION OF INTOXICATION LIQUORS INTO STATES WITH LAWS PROHIBITING THE SALES OF SUCH LIQUORS.

TO AMEND H.R. 9682, BY REDUCING THE PAYROLL TAX FOR SOCIAL SECURITY TO AN INITIAL RATE OF 1 PERCENT, INCREASING TO A MAXIMUM OF 5 PERCENT IN 20 YEARS, INSTEAD OF HAVING AN INITIAL RATE OF 2 PERCENT, RISING TO 6 PERCENT IN 12 YEARS.
TO AMEND H.R. 9682, BY ENACTING A LEVY IN THE NATURE OF A COMPENSATORY TAX ON JUTE AND JUTE PRODUCTS IN THE EFFORT TO SECURE COMPENSATION FOR THE COTTON FARMER.

TO AMEND H.R. 9682, BY PROVIDING FOR TARIFF EQUILIZATION FEES ON THE MANUFACTURING OF COTTON, SYNTHETIC FIBERS, WHEAT, RICE, TOBACCO, AND FIELD CORN.  THESE FEES ARE SOME- WHAT SIMILAR TO THE PROCESSING TAX UNDER THE AGRICULTURAL ADJUSTMENT ACT BUT DIFFEENT IN PARTICULARS
TO AMEND H.R. 9682, BY RAISING SURTAXES IN BRACKETS OVER $3,000.
TO AMEND H.R. 9682, BY IMPOSING A TAX UPON ALL NEW ISSUES OF FEDERAL.

TO AMEND H.R. 9682, BY REMOVING THE TAX EXEMPT STATUS OF THE "INTEREST UPON OBLIGATIONS OF THE UNITED STATES OR ITS POSSESSIONS, OR OF ANY STATE, TERRITORY, OR ANY POLITICAL SUBDIVISION THEREOF, OR THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, ISSUED SUBSEQUENT TO JULY 1, 138."
TO AMEND S. 3022, PROVIDING FOR APPOINTMENT OF POSTMASTERS, BY PLACING POSTMASTERS WITHIN THE CIVIL SERVICE LAWS.  THE AMENDMENT IS IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE.
TO CONSIDER S. 847, A BILL TO PREVENT THE USE OF FEDERAL OFFICIAL PATRONAGE IN ELECTIONS AND TO PROHIBIT FEDERAL OFFICEHOLDERS FROM MISUSE OF POSITIONS OF PUBLIC TRUST FOR PRIVATE AND PARTISAN ENDS.

TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE COMMITTEE ON BANKING AND CURRENCY WAS DISCHARGED FROM THE FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF S. 3428, RELATING TO PUBLIC WORKS, REFERRED TO THE COMMITTEE ON POST OFFICES AND POST ROADS.

TO AMEND S. 847, RELATING TO THE POLITICAL ACTIVITIES OF FEDERAL EMPLOYEES, BY ELIMINATING ELECTIVE OFFICERS AND PRESIDENTIAL ADVISORS APPOINTED WITH THE APPROVAL OF THE SENATE FROM THE PROVISIONS OF THE ACT.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 8837, APPROPRIATIONS FOR EXECUTIVE OFFICE, TO INSIST UPON AMENDMENTS RELATING TO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AUTHORITY AND APPROPRIATIONS TO COMMENCE WORK ON THE GILBERTSVILLE DAM.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 8837, APPROPRIATIONS FOR EXECUTIVE OFFICE, TO RECEDE AND CONCUR ON AMENDMENT NO. 28, KNOWN AS THE OLEOMARGARINE.
TO AMEND H.R. 9218, A BILL RELATING TO THE COMPOSITION OF U.S. NAVY, BY AUTHORIZING THE CONSTRUCTION OF ADDITIONAL.
TO PASS H.R. 9218, A BILL RELATING TO THE COMPOSITION OF U.S. NAVY.

TO AMEND S. 3078, A BILL RELATING TO THE MERCHANT MARINE, BY STRIKING SECTION 604 OF THE MERCHANT MARINE ACT OF 1936 WHICH ALLOWS THE MERCHANT MARINE COMMISSION TO GRANT ADDITIONAL SUBSIDIES UPON THE RECOMMENDATION OF THE SECRETARY OF STATE WHERE THE NORAL SUBSIDY IS INADEQUATE TO OFFSET THE EFFECT OF GOVERNMENT AID PAID TO FOREIGN COMPETITORS.

TO AMEND S. 3845, A BILL ESTABLISHING A CIVIL AERONAUTICS AUTHORITY, BY REMOVING THE FOLLOWING SENTENCE:  "ANY MENBER OF THE AUTHORITY MAY BE REMOVED BY THE PRESIDENT FOR INEFFICIENCY, NEGLECT OF DUTY, OR MALFEASANCE IN OFFICE." THIS SENTENCE WAS CONSIDEED UNNECESSARY SINCE THE PRESIDENT HAD THE POWER OF APPOINTMENT IT WAS UNDERSTOOD THAT HE ALSO HAD THE POWER OF REMOVAL.

TO RECONSIDER AN AMENDMENT TO S. 3845, A BILL ESTABLISHING THE CIVIL AERONAUTICS AUTHORITY, OFFERED BY SENATOR TRUMAN. THE AMENDMENT REMOVED THE FOLLOWING SENTENCE FROM THE BILL: "ANY MEMBER OF THE AUTHORITY MAY BE REMOVED BY THE PRES. FOR INEFFICIENCY, EGLECT OF DUTY, OR MALFEASANCE IN OFFICE."
TO TABLE THE MOTION OF SENATOR MINTON TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH S. 3793, THE FEDERAL POWER ACT WAS PASSED.
TO AMEND H.J. RES. 679, A BILL MAKING WORK RELIEF APPROPRIA- TIONS, BY INCREASING THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE NATIONAL RESOURCES COMMITTEE FROM $250,000 TO $750,000.
TO AMEND H.J. RES. 679, BY SETTING UP A BOARD OF ARBITRATION IN CASES WHERE MUNICIPALITIES ATTEMPT TO SET UP A PUBLICLY OWNED POWER PLANT WHERE A PRIVATE PLANT WAS ALREADY IN EXISTENCE.

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 679, BY REDUCING THE APPROPRIATION FOR SO-CALLED "PUMP-PRIMING" PROGRAMS WHICH ALLOCATE MONEY FOR STRUCTURES AND BUILDING MATERIALS, AND WOULD INCREASE THE ALLOCATION FOR WORK RELIEF.

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 679, BY ADDING A PROVISION PROHIBITING ANY PERSON COMPENSATED FUNDS APPROPRIATED IN THIS BILL FROM USING HIS OFFICIAL AUTHORITY OR INFLUENCE TO INTERFERE WITH OR AFFECT THE RESULTS OF ANY ELECTION.
TO AMEND H.J. RES. 679, BY PROVIDING APPROPRIATIONS FOR BOTH THE MERRIMACK RIVER AND FOR DAMAGES TO THE CITY WATERWORKS OF LEAVENWORTH, KANSAS BY NAVIGATION IMPROVEMENTS IN THE MISSOURI RIVER.
TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO H.J. RES. 679, PROPOSED BY SENATOR LODGE, WHICH WOULD HAVE RAISED SOCIAL SECURITY PAYMENTS.
TO AMEND H.J. RES. 679, BY AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR TITLE I.

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 679, BY DESIGNATING $50,000,000 OF THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE PURCHASE OF FOOD FOR RELIEF DISTRIBU- TION WITH THE PURPOSE OF MAINTAINING THE PRICE STRUCTURE FOR COMMODITIES OTHER THAN THOSE COVERED IN THE FARM BILL.

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 679, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING PROVISION: "THAT IN NO CASE SHALL THE MONTHLY COMPENSATION FOR PERSONS ENGAGED IN PROJECTS UNDER THE FOREGOING APPROPRIATION BE AT THE RATE OF LESS THAN $40."

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 679, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING PROVISION: "THAT ANY PERSONS RECEIVING SALARIES FOR ADMINISTRATIVE WORK UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF THIS RESOLUTION, AND WHO HAVE COMPLETED 12 MONTHS OF SERVICE AS EXECUTIVE-ORDER EMPLOYEES PRIOR TO THE DATE OFPASSAGE OF THIS RESOLUTION, SHALL ACQUIRE A CIVIL-SERVICE STATUS ON JUNE 30, 1939, WITH THE FOLLOWING PROVISIONS:  THAT THE PRESIDENT IS HEREBY AUTHO- RIZED AND DIRECTED TO ORDER NONCOMPETITIVE EXAMINATIONS BE HELD BY THE CIVIL SERVICE COMMISSION, BEFORE ...
TO AMEND H.J. RES. 679.  THE AMENDMENT WAS DESIGNED TO PRE- VENT THE USE OF FUNDS APPROPRIATED FOR RELIEF FOR POLITICAL PURPOSES.

TO RECONSIDER AN AMENDMENT TO H.J. RES. 679 OFFERED BY SENATOR HATCH WHICH PROHIBITED THE ADMINISTRATORS OF WORK RELIEF FROM USING THEIR OFFICIAL AUTHORITY TO INFLUENCE CONVENTIONS, PRIMARIES OR ELECTIONS.
TO AMEND H.J. RES. 679, BY LIMITING THE EXPENSE FOR ADMINIS- TRATIVE PURPOSES TO 5 PERCENT AND STRIKING ALL THE PRO- VISIONS FOR PUBLIC WORKS IN TITLE II OF THE BILL.
TO PASS H.J. RES. 679.
TO AMEND S.J. RES. 300, A RESOLUTION RELATING TO THE NATIONAL ECONOMIC COMMITTEE, BY REQUIRING THAT THE COMMITTEE FOR APPROPRIATIONS MUST APPLY FOR FUNDS BEFORE THE PRESIDENT COULD RELEASE THEM.
TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 1531, A BILL EXTENDING THE CLASSIFIED CIVIL SERVICE TO INCLUDE POSTMASTERS OF THE FIRST, SECOND, AND THIRD CLASSES.

TO AMEND H.R. 10851, A BILL MAKING DEFICIENCY APPROPRIATIONS, BY INCREASING THE APPROPRIATION TO INAUGU- RATE A CAMPAIGN OF COOPERATION BETWEEN THE FED. GOVERNMENT AND THE SEVERAL STATES FOR THE ERADICATION AND CONTROL OF VENEREAL DISEASES FROM $1,500,00 TO $3,000,000.

TO AMEND H.R. 10851, A BILL MAKING DEFICIENCY APPROPRIA- TIONS, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING PROVISION:  "FOR CARRYING OUT THE PROVISIONS OF THE COOPERATIVE FARM FORESTRY ACT, APPROVED MAY 18, 1937, $1,300,000, WHICH AMOUNT SHALL BE AVAILABLE FOR THE APPOINTMNT OF PERSONS AND MEANS IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA AND ELSEWHERE; PROVIDED, THAT NOT MORE THAN 20 PERCENT OF THIS AMOUNT SHALL BE EXPERIENCED IN THE PRAIRIE STATES FORESTRY PROJECT IN THE PRAIRIE PLAIN REGION."
TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 10618, A BILL AUTHO- RIZING CONSTRUCTION OF PUBLIC WORKS.

TO OVERRIDE VETO ON H.R. 10530, "AN ACT TO EXTEND FOR 2 ADDITIONAL YEARS THE 3 1/2 PERCENT INTEREST ON CERTAIN FEDERAL LAND BANK LOANS, AND TO PROVIDE FOR A 4 PERCENT INTEREST RATE ON LAND BANK COMMISSIONER'S LOANS UNTIL JULY 1, 1940."
TO CONSIDER THE NOMINATION OF WILLIAM CLARK OF NEW JERSEY TO BE A JUDGE OF THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT OF APPEALS FOR THE THIRD CIRCUIT.
TO CONFIRM THE NOMINATION OF WILLIAM CLARK TO BE A JUDGE OF THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT OF APPEALS FOR THE THIRD CIRCUIT.
